Shadowfax, which has seen its market share rise from about 8% in FY22

articles.title: Why Elon Musk is seeking up to $134 billion from OpenAI, Microsoft in 'wrongful gains'
articles.summary: OpenAI gained between $65.5 billion and $109.4 billion from the billionaire entrepreneur's contributions when he was co-founding OpenAI from 2015, while ‌Microsoft gained ‌between $13.3 billion and $25.1 billion, Musk said in the federal court filing ahead of his trial against ‌the two companies.

articles.title: 'Can't wait to start trial': Elon Musk slams OpenAI ahead of court case; Sam Altman responds
articles.summary: Ahead of a jury trial that is set to begin in May, both sides are releasing certain documents and call notes, accusing each other of bad faith over OpenAI’s shift from a nonprofit to a for-profit model.

articles.title: Nvidia H200 chip parts suppliers halt output after China blocks shipments: Report
articles.summary: Nvidia had expected more than 1 million orders from Chinese clients, the report said, adding that its suppliers had been operating around the clock ​to prepare for shipping as ​early as March.

articles.title: Reliance’s JioMart hits 1.6 million daily orders, claims to be second-largest qcomm player in India
articles.summary: JioMart now operates across more than 5,000 pin codes, supported by over 3,000 stores in over 1,000 cities. Without disclosing exact figures, Reliance claimed that transaction frequency on its digital platforms is roughly twice that of competitors.

articles.title: Quick commerce market heats up; Blinkit drops delivery fees in select markets
articles.summary: Blinkit has cut delivery fees in select micro-markets like Gurgaon, Bengaluru and Mumbai to stay competitive against Amazon Now and Flipkart Minutes. Other quick commerce players, including Zepto and Instamart, had already reduced charges. The move aims to retain customers as rapid expansion and dark store growth intensify market competition.

articles.title: Tiger in net, blackstone in woods: Supreme Court's Tiger Global tax ruling could influence Blackstone dispute
articles.summary: Blackstone faces a significant legal challenge from India's tax department. The dispute centers on tax residency and treaty benefits for foreign investors. This case, similar to the Tiger Global matter, will test the validity of tax residency certificates. The outcome could impact how offshore investors are taxed in India. Control and beneficial ownership are key points of contention.

articles.title: Social media platforms removed 4.7 million accounts after Australia banned them for children
articles.summary: Australia has successfully banned social media for children under 16. Nearly 4.7 million accounts have been removed since the law took effect. This landmark decision aims to protect young people from harmful online environments. Officials report strong compliance from major platforms. Other countries are now considering similar measures. This move is seen as a victory for child safety.

articles.title: Tech Mahindra Q3 Results: Profit rises 14% YoY to Rs 1,122 crore, revenue up 8%
articles.summary: Tech Mahindra Q3 Results: Tech Mahindra reported a 14.1% year-on-year rise in December quarter consolidated profit to Rs 1,122 crore, with revenue climbing 8.3% to Rs 14,393 crore. The company saw a significant 47% year-on-year increase in new deal wins, reaching $1,096 million, highlighting strong momentum and sustained investments in AI-led offerings.

articles.title: Wipro Q3 Results: Profit falls 7% YoY to Rs 3,119 crore; co declares dividend of Rs 6 per share
articles.summary: Wipro Q3 Results: The company's board approved an interim dividend of Rs 6 per share and fixed January 27 as the record date. The payment will be made on or before February 14.

articles.title: TikTok to tighten age checks in Europe as regulators ramp up pressure
articles.summary: TikTok ‍will start rolling out new ​age-detection technology across Europe in the coming weeks as the ByteDance-owned platform faces regulatory pressure to better identify and remove accounts belonging to children under 13.

articles.title: Remarks on deeptech startups at Startup Mahakumbh last year ‘not necessarily accurate’: Piyush Goyal
articles.summary: Last April, the commerce and industry minister urged Indian startups to move beyond instant delivery apps and focus on high-tech domains such as semiconductors, robotics, AI, and next-gen manufacturing.

articles.title: IIT Indore develops human-like AI powered replica to detect disease in human body
articles.summary: The Madhya Pradesh Regional AI Impact Conference 2026, held in Bhopal on January 15, featured an artificial intelligence (AI)-powered human body replica to detect diseases, which drew attention from researchers, medical professionals, and technology experts.

articles.title: Viettel begins construction of Vietnam's first chip plant, trial run targeted by end‑2027
articles.summary: Vietnam's military-run telecom company Viettel on Friday began ‍construction of the country's first ​semiconductor fabrication plant, with trial production expected to start ⁠by late 2027, part of Vietnam's plan to create its own semiconductor manufacturing ecosystem.

articles.title: BBC to strike content deal with YouTube, FT reports
articles.summary: The ‍BBC plans ​to produce programmes ⁠for YouTube for the first time, marking a ‌major ‌strategic shift as it ‌seeks to recapture audiences moving to US tech platforms.

articles.title: Blinkit shows dark store distance on app after removing 10-minute delivery pledge
articles.summary: This development comes days after quick commerce companies removed 10-minute delivery pledges from their apps and other places after the government directed them to do so on Tuesday.

articles.title: CCPA fines Meta, Amazon, Flipkart, Meesho Rs 10 lakh each for illegal walkie-talkie sales
articles.summary: The Central Consumer Protection Authority (CCPA) has initiated suo motu action against e-commerce platforms for listing and selling unauthorised walkie-talkies in violation of the Consumer Protection Act, 2019 and telecom laws, issuing final orders against eight entities and imposing penalties totalling Rs 44 lakh.

articles.title: Walmart International chief Kathryn McLay to step down after two years
articles.summary: Kathryn McLay will step down as CEO ‌of its Walmart ‌International unit on January 31 but will remain with the company through the first quarter ‌to help ensure a smooth transition. McLay's departure comes two months after the Bentonville, Arkansas-based retailer announced that its CEO of 12 years, Doug McMillon, ​would be stepping down and succeeded by ​US division chief John Furner.

articles.title: Social media sites block 4.7 million underage accounts in Australia
articles.summary: Tech giants have blocked 4.7 million accounts under Australia's world-first social media ban for under-16s, the country's online safety watchdog said Friday. "Given the vast number of online services and the fast-evolving nature of the tech industry, it's impossible to list all of the services which meet the conditions and are obliged to comply with the social media minimum age obligation," she said.

articles.title: Meet the new Indian-origin CTO of Mira Murati’s Thinking Machines
articles.summary: Hyderabad-born Chintala, who joined Thinking Machines Lab in November 2025, will replace Barret Zoph who stepped down as CTO. Announcing his appointment, Murati described Chintala as “a brilliant and seasoned leader who has made important contributions to the AI field for over a decade” in a post on microblogging platform X.

articles.title: VC firm Kairon Capital debuts with Rs 200 crore fund
articles.summary: Deepankur Malhotra, a former executive at Amazon India, where he focused on investing in consumer brands, has launched a consumer-focused venture capital firm, Kairon Capital, with a target corpus of Rs 200 crore, including a Rs 50-crore greenshoe option.

articles.title: Student loan companies feel the pressure of US visa squeeze
articles.summary: Education loans for studying abroad fell 30–50% in 2025, hit hardest by tighter US visa norms. Students are turning to Europe and smaller destinations, but loans are smaller and repayment risks higher. Lenders, especially NBFCs, are shifting focus to domestic programmes and alternative geographies to manage growth and risk.

articles.title: X revises developer API policies, bans ‘InfoFi’ apps to tackle bot spam
articles.summary: Confirming the development, X’s head of product Nikita Bier said apps that financially reward users for posting on X will no longer be permitted under the platform’s API terms.

articles.title: India warns Apple it will proceed with antitrust case after company plays for time
articles.summary: India has issued a final warning to Apple regarding an antitrust case. The Competition Commission of India stated that Apple has delayed responses for over a year. This has undermined the investigation. Apple fears a potential fine of up to $38 billion. The company has challenged penalty rules in court. The CCI rejected Apple's request to pause the case.

articles.title: Amazon expands 'sovereign cloud' in Europe
articles.summary: Amazon's cloud computing division said Thursday that it would expand its "sovereign cloud" across the European Union, hoping to cash in as EU governments seek to safeguard their citizens' data.

articles.title: Quick commerce riders unaware that 10-minute delivery claim has been removed
articles.summary: A day after quick commerce companies revamped their apps to remove the 10-minute delivery claim, the gig workers at the centre of this issue remain unaware of the developments. Quick commerce majors have been repeatedly saying that delivery timelines are not displayed to last-mile workers and they are not penalised for delays. However, delivery partners said that consumers still expect their orders to get delivered within 10-minutes.

articles.title: Commerce Ministry formulates specific guidelines for missions abroad to boost exports
articles.summary: New guidelines are in place for Indian missions abroad. The government aims to boost exports by diversifying markets. These steps are crucial amid global economic uncertainties. Commercial representatives will manage trade barriers and conduct market research. The goal is to leverage free trade agreements and increase their utilization. India targets USD 2 trillion in exports by 2030.

articles.title: India-US partnership is growing across trade, technology: US Ambassador to India, Sergio Gor
articles.summary: US Ambassador to India, Sergio Gor, on Sunday concluded his 'successful' visit to Mumbai, highlighting the growing partnership between India and the United States across trade, technology, education, energy and resilient supply chains.

articles.title: India to grow at a healthy 7% in 2026-27 despite global uncertainties: CareEdge
articles.summary: CareEdge Ratings expects the Indian economy to grow by 7 per cent in 2026-27 despite global uncertainties, supported by low inflation, softer interest rates and a lower tax burden. The rating agency said services exports would continue to support the external position even as merchandise exports face pressure from tariff-related uncertainties.

articles.title: Mother of all trade deals is loading: What it means for India
articles.summary: India and EU are on the cusp of a landmark Free Trade Agreement, potentially dubbed the 'mother of all deals.' This pact, two decades in the making, aims to boost bilateral trade and investment, offering a crucial diversification avenue amidst rising protectionism. Key sticking points include market access for automobiles and agriculture, but a breakthrough could reshape global trade.

articles.title: India's average return on FDI remains robust at 7.3%, outperforming emerging economies: CareEdge
articles.summary: India saw gross FDI inflows rise to USD 81 billion in FY25. However, increased profit repatriation and outflows significantly reduced net FDI to just USD 1 billion. Despite this, India's return on inward FDI remains strong. Emerging sectors like semiconductors and EVs are attracting foreign investment. Global FDI flows are lagging GDP growth.

articles.title: India–EU FTA likely to spur textiles, pharma, engineering sectors: exporters
articles.summary: A free trade agreement between India and the European Union is set to boost exports in textiles, pharmaceuticals, chemicals, and engineering goods. Exporters anticipate a doubling of shipments to the EU within three years. This pact offers a stable framework for Indian businesses, aiding long-term investments and market access. It also helps diversify export markets, reducing reliance on single regions.

articles.title: Indian Jute Mills Association seeks ban on private raw jute trading
articles.summary: The Indian Jute Mills Association has asked the government to stop private raw jute trading after March 31. This move aims to control rising prices and ensure fibre availability for mills. The association claims many mills have shut down, leaving thousands jobless. The proposal seeks to stabilize prices and secure jute bag supply for upcoming seasons.

articles.title: Budget 2026: EV incentives, step up R&D, localisation push on wishlist
articles.summary: India's upcoming Union Budget is expected to boost electric vehicle adoption. Measures will likely focus on strengthening domestic manufacturing and reducing reliance on imports. Incentives could be recalibrated to encourage investment across the EV value chain. This aims to support sustainable transport and conserve foreign exchange.

articles.title: Mother of all deals: Piyush Goyal on upcoming FTA with European Union
articles.summary: India's Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal hailed the proposed Free Trade Agreement with the European Union as the "mother of all deals," anticipating a mutually beneficial pact that will boost exports. He assured that national interests would not be compromised, with sensitive issues like the Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism and dairy to be addressed satisfactorily.

articles.title: India works to protect Chabahar Port after waiver ends
articles.summary: India is gearing up to unveil an innovative strategy for Chabahar Port, paving the way for strengthening its stake following the anticipated end of US sanctions in April. Collaborating with a regional Iranian firm, India Ports Global Limited aims to regain operational control over this crucial port.

articles.title: Cross-border e-commerce gets a legup, postal exports put on par with cargo shipments
articles.summary: Government reforms now treat postal e-commerce exports like regular cargo, enabling speedier clearances and access to key export incentives. These changes, effective January 15, address a procedural bottleneck, benefiting small sellers and e-commerce firms by streamlining processes and improving cash flow for digital-first exporters.

articles.title: Microcredit scheme for gig, platform workers in works
articles.summary: A new microcredit scheme is being finalized to offer collateral-free loans up to Rs 10,000 annually to gig workers and domestic helps. This initiative aims to support entrepreneurial journeys for vulnerable sections. The scheme will be launched in the next fiscal year, starting April 2026.

articles.title: Gems, jewellery exports dip 4.98% in December to $1,883.85 million: GJEPC
articles.summary: India's gem and jewellery exports saw a dip in December 2025. Geopolitical issues impacted demand in key markets. However, overall exports remained stable. Jewellery exports, especially gold and silver, showed strong growth. This balanced out a slowdown in cut and polished diamonds. Free Trade Agreements are boosting exports to countries like the UAE and Australia.

articles.title: India's textile exports maintain growth momentum in December despite tariff shocks
articles.summary: India's textile and apparel exports grew for the second month in December. This growth shows the sector's adaptability and strength in value-added products. Handicrafts, ready-made garments, and MMF yarn led the expansion. Exports remained stable for the full year. India's market presence broadened significantly across many countries, highlighting its position as a reliable global sourcing hub.

articles.title: Labour Codes may become effective from April 1
articles.summary: Sources said the ministry of labour and employment is considering making Labour Codes effective only from the next financial year (FY’27) to coincide with India Inc’s financial cycle as the change in salary structure under the Codes could result in higher outgo towards provident fund and gratuity, thus impacting the balance sheets of the companies.

articles.title: EPFO members can withdraw EPF money through UPI by April
articles.summary: EPFO members will soon withdraw provident fund directly to bank accounts using UPI. This new system aims for a secure and quick transfer of funds. The labour ministry is working to resolve software issues for a smooth rollout. This initiative will benefit around eight crore members, simplifying access to their EPF money for various needs.

articles.title: RBI raises Ombudsman compensation cap to Rs 30 lakh for banking customers
articles.summary: The Reserve Bank of India has increased the compensation limit for customers to Rs 30 lakh for consequential losses and Rs 3 lakh for harassment, effective July 1, 2026. This move aims to provide meaningful relief to consumers while balancing the interests of regulated entities.

articles.title: Exports 'highly positive' in January so far: Piyush Goyal
articles.summary: India's exports are showing strong positive growth in January. This is happening even with global economic uncertainties. The Commerce and Industry Minister, Piyush Goyal, shared this optimistic outlook. Official figures for January exports and imports will be released on February 15. This follows December's merchandise export growth and a trade deficit.

articles.title: India’s forex reserves up by $392 million to $687.19 billion as of January 9
articles.summary: India's foreign exchange reserves saw a rise of $392 million, reaching $687.19 billion by January 9, 2026. This follows a significant drop in the previous week. Foreign currency assets decreased, while gold holdings increased. Special Drawing Rights and the country's position with the International Monetary Fund also saw minor declines.

articles.title: Live near a metro station? Your home loan may get easier
articles.summary: New research reveals metro station proximity positively impacts home loan EMIs by reducing transport costs and private vehicle reliance. This strengthens household balance sheets, improves financial discipline, and contributes to broader financial stability. The study highlights significant reductions in mortgage delinquency and increases in prepayments in metro-connected areas.

articles.title: Maruti Suzuki commences Victoris export, badged as 'Across'
articles.summary: Maruti Suzuki has commenced exports of its mid-size SUV, Victoris, to global markets, with over 450 vehicles already shipped. The SUV, to be sold internationally as 'Across', will reach approximately 100 countries. This move aligns with the company's 'Make in India, Make for the World' vision, bolstering its position as India's leading passenger vehicle exporter.

articles.title: Quiet Repair, Real Power: How Budget 2026 can turn India’s demography into growth
articles.summary: India Budget: As the Union Budget approaches, the focus shifts to strengthening public finances and reshaping India's growth engine for durability and inclusivity. Recent policy boosts have supported consumption, but sustained income growth hinges on job creation, particularly in non-farm sectors. Budget 2026 has an opportunity to foster job-rich growth through targeted incentives for manufacturing and MSMEs, alongside addressing women's workforce participation.

articles.title: India, Germany sign telecom pact as PM Modi–Chancellor Merz push for digital cooperation
articles.summary: India and Germany have signed a Joint Declaration of Intent on Telecommunications Cooperation, aiming to deepen collaboration in emerging digital technologies, policy frameworks, and manufacturing. This agreement, a key outcome of Prime Minister Modi's meeting with German Chancellor Friedrich Merz, establishes a framework for regular consultations and joint efforts to foster inclusive and sustainable digital transformation.

articles.title: India's UPI miracle has a money problem; can Budget 2026 fix it?
articles.summary: Union Budget News: India's UPI digital payment system faces a crucial decision ahead of Budget 2026. While UPI has revolutionized transactions, its zero Merchant Discount Rate policy is straining payment companies and banks. Urgent action is needed to ensure the system's long-term viability and continued growth across the nation.

articles.title: India been a key driver of global growth: IMF spokesperson says as it looks to upgrade growth forecast soon
articles.summary: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) is likely to upgrade its India growth forecast for the upcoming World Economic Outlook in January. IMF spokesperson Julie Kozack highlighted India's robust economic growth, noting that third-quarter figures exceeded expectations. India is recognized as a significant engine for global economic expansion.

articles.title: 'One of the most promising crops': Mizoram CM Lalduhoma shares updates on state's big rubber plantation push
articles.summary: The Chief Minister said that the Chief Minister’s Rubber Mission was launched with the objective of transforming Mizoram into a major rubber-producing region.

articles.title: After 41-month high, Trump's tariffs drag India's export growth in December
articles.summary: India Export Data: India's trade deficit grew in December as exports slowed. Despite challenges, overall outbound shipments saw modest growth. Diversification strategies are deepening trade ties with West Asia, Europe, and other regions. Services exports also saw a contraction. Government initiatives are supporting exporters, with positive growth expected in goods and services trade for the fiscal year.

articles.title: India-US talks on 'virtually', trade deal near finish line
articles.summary: In the last week of December, commerce and industry minister Piyush Goyal had a virtual meeting with US trade representative Jamieson Greer.

articles.title: Urban mobility infra strengthened household finances: EAC-PM
articles.summary: According to the paper, investments in urban mobility infrastructure over the past decade, particularly metro rail expansion, have translated into stronger household liquidity management and more disciplined borrowing.

articles.title: Unemployment rate up a tad to 4.8% in December
articles.summary: India's unemployment rate saw a slight increase in December, reaching 4.8 percent from 4.7 percent in November. This rise was driven by joblessness in urban areas, while rural unemployment remained steady. The overall jobless rate for men and women also edged up. Youth unemployment experienced a small increase.

articles.title: Textiles & apparel exports fall in first three quarters of FY26
articles.summary: Indian textile and apparel exports saw a slight dip in the first nine months of FY26. Textile shipments declined, while apparel exports showed growth. Restrictions in Bangladesh and market uncertainties in the US impacted yarn and fabric sales. Some exporters offered discounts to maintain sales volumes. Companies heavily reliant on the US for home textiles faced significant challenges.

articles.title: Expecting India's 2025-26 overall exports to touch USD 850 billion: Commerce Secretary
articles.summary: India is projected to surpass USD 850 billion in total exports for FY 2025-26, building on a strong performance in both merchandise and services. For the first nine months of the fiscal year, overall exports reached USD 634.26 billion, a 4.33% increase from the previous year. The services sector continues to be the primary driver of this growth.

articles.title: Jane Street India unit saw trading gains soar 494% before curbs
articles.summary: Jane Street Group’s India unit posted a sharp surge in trading gains in FY25, reporting nearly six-fold growth before regulatory curbs halted its operations over alleged market manipulation. Net trading gains rose to Rs 47 billion, while after-tax profit jumped 494% year-on-year, underscoring the scale of profits earned ahead of the regulator’s action.

articles.title: After a tough 2025, 2026 looks more constructive for smallcaps: Anupam Tiwari
articles.summary: Smallcap investors can anticipate a more constructive 2026. Expectations have reset after a challenging 2025. The focus will shift to selecting individual stocks with strong fundamentals. Companies demonstrating balance-sheet discipline and quality-led growth will lead the way. This selective approach is key for navigating the smallcap segment. Long-term investors can find attractive opportunities.

articles.title: Blackstone’s big AI bet; India’s nano GCC split
articles.summary: Happy Monday! Investment major Blackstone has struck a deal to take a controlling stake in AI infra startup Neysa. Details of the transaction and more in today’s ETtech Morning Dispatch.

articles.title: Why are Americans paying for ChatGPT in India, asks US trade adviser Navarro
articles.summary: US trade adviser Peter Navarro criticised India for using AI platforms like ChatGPT built in the US, saying Americans are paying for these services. He defended steep tariffs on Indian imports over Russian oil and warned that foreign buyers paying above-market prices for US farmland could drive up domestic food costs.

articles.title: Sequoia to join GIC, Coatue in Anthropic investment: FT
articles.summary: Venture capital group Sequoia is set to back Anthropic alongside Singapore’s GIC and US firm Coatue in a new funding round. The investment would value the artificial intelligence company at about $350 billion, according to the Financial Times.

articles.title: EXL eyes two new India centres as AI spend set to rise in 2026
articles.summary: Exlservice Holdings is set to open two new centers in smaller Indian cities this year. The data and AI company aims to tap into better infrastructure and talent outside major metros. This expansion aligns with rising global IT spends focused on AI, infrastructure, and cybersecurity.

articles.title: AI adoption outpaces training; 71% professionals expect role changes: Report
articles.summary: Artificial Intelligence is rapidly changing workplaces. Many professionals expect their jobs to evolve significantly in the coming years due to AI. However, a large number feel their companies are not providing adequate training on AI tools. This lack of guidance leads to uncertainty about AI's role.

articles.title: Tech giants like Google and Amazon want retailers to use AI everywhere
articles.summary: Businesses are rapidly adopting artificial intelligence across all operations. From sales to hiring, companies aim to leverage AI to enhance efficiency and customer experience. Retail giants and startups alike are developing AI solutions.

articles.title: India’s big IT ends recruitment freeze, but only for niche skills
articles.summary: India’s top five IT companies added 2,505 employees to their combined headcount in calendar year 2025, after shedding nearly the same number the year before, reflecting selective and skill-based hiring.

articles.title: AIX Ventures cofounder Shaun Johnson departs
articles.summary: AIX Ventures — a venture capital firm that has backed artificial intelligence startups including Perplexity, Windsurf and Ideogram — saw cofounder Shaun Johnson exit the firm last month.

articles.title: Can AI generate new ideas?
articles.summary: AI firm Harmonic claims its system Aristotle, aided by GPT-5.2 Pro, solved long-standing problems posed by Paul Erdos. Some hail this as real research progress, while skeptics like Terence Tao argue AI mainly repackages existing human knowledge.

articles.title: 146 startups get Rs 38 crore grant under Karnataka govt's Elevate programme
articles.summary: Elevate provides a one-time grant-in-aid of up to Rs 50 lakhs to start-ups recognised under this programme. In addition, they are given mentoring and incubation support at subsidised rates at government-supported incubation centres to help in product development and validation, the Department of Electronics, IT BT said.

articles.title: Alarm in Germany over AI holocaust imagery
articles.summary: Germany's government and Holocaust memorial institutions have demanded social ‍media platforms stop the spread ​of fake images which they say are distorting and trivialising ⁠history.

articles.title: ChatGPT's free ride is ending: Here's what OpenAI plans for advertising on the chatbot
articles.summary: OpenAI says it will soon start showing advertisements to ChatGPT users who aren't paying for a premium version of the chatbot. The artificial intelligence company said Friday it hasn't yet rolled out ads but will start testing them in the coming weeks.

articles.title: California AG sends letter demanding xAI stop producing deekfake content
articles.summary: California ⁠Attorney General Robert Bonta on Friday sent ‌a ‌cease and desist ‌letter to xAI demanding the company stop the creation ​and distribution ​of AI-generated non-consensual ‌sexualised ‍imagery by ‍its Grok AI chatbot.

articles.title: Kerala's educational AI platform receives national recognition
articles.summary: The AI platform of the Kerala Infrastructure and Technology for Education (KITE) has been honoured at the 6th Governance Now Digital Transformation Summit held in New Delhi on Friday, an official statement said on Saturday.

articles.title: Spacetech startup EtherealX raises $20 million in round co-led by TDK Ventures, BIG Capital
articles.summary: Accel, Prosus, YourNest Venture Capital, BlueHill Capital, Campus Fund, and Riceberg Ventures also participated in the funding round. The maker of reusable rockets plans to fly its 35-metre-tall technology demonstrator vehicle (TDV), consisting of an eight-engine booster and an upper stage, in 2027, primarily to gather flight data, followed by the first flight of its full-scale commercial launcher, the reusable Razor Crest Mk-1, by the end of 2028, and begin commercial operations thereafter.

articles.title: Wipro Q3 profit misses estimates as one-time charges drag profit
articles.summary: Srini Pallia, CEO, Wipro: Clients are definitely looking to take costs out through vendor consolidation, and bring the efficiency and productivity through AI into the existing run and operate situations

articles.title: Tech Mahindra posts strongest December quarter in three years
articles.summary: Tech Mahindra posted its strongest quarterly performance in three years, with net profit rising 14% year-on-year to Rs 1,122 crore and revenue up 8% to Rs 14,393 crore, supported by large deal wins and core vertical growth. Margins improved for the ninth consecutive quarter, aided by operational efficiencies and AI-led initiatives. Headcount fell to 149,616 as hiring slowed.

articles.title: OpenAI introducing ads to ChatGPT
articles.summary: OpenAI will soon test ads on ChatGPT in the US for free and lower-tier users, aiming to cover rising operational costs. The company stressed that ads will not affect responses or user privacy. With few paying subscribers, OpenAI is seeking new revenue while competing with AI rivals like Google.

articles.title: PSU banks attractive, domestic demand key; earnings, not valuations, will bring FIIs back: Raamdeo Agrawal
articles.summary: Raamdeo Agrawal, Chairman of Motilal Oswal says PSU banks are among the cheapest opportunities today after years of cleanup. He expects credit growth and domestic demand to drive a multiplier effect, sees earnings picking up over the next year, and warns that excessive valuations—not weak businesses—are behind recent stock corrections.

articles.title: Rupee recovers after fresh RBI intervention, follow-through uncertain
articles.summary: The Indian rupee saw a rebound on Thursday following intervention by the Reserve Bank of India, though its long-term stability remains a concern for bankers. Despite the RBI's efforts to strengthen the currency, experts advise importers to hedge against potential future depreciation due to an uncertain trade deal outlook and subdued foreign inflows.

articles.title: Nvidia at CES 2026; Puneet Kumar quits Nexus
articles.summary: AI chipmaker Nvidia put forward its vision to own the AI stack at CES 2026 in Las Vegas. This and more in today's ETtech Top 5.

articles.title: The unnatural beauty of Dhurandhar: Why Aditya Dhar's polarising film works as pure cinema
articles.summary: A visually arresting, fiercely polarising action thriller, Dhurandhar transcends propaganda debates through raw performances, brutal choreography, and an uncanny portrayal of familiar worlds rendered disturbingly strange.

articles.title: One of America’s most successful experiments with Indians is coming to a shuddering halt
articles.summary: A prominent Hindu deity statue inauguration in Texas sparks protests and political backlash. This incident highlights growing anti-Indian sentiment in America. Highly skilled Indian immigrants, long seen as a success story, now face challenges. Visa policies and rhetoric are impacting their ability to work and live in the US. This shift questions America's welcoming image for global talent.

articles.title: Ties with India witness a downturn as Bangladesh navigates turbulent 2025
articles.summary: Bangladesh faced a turbulent 2025 marked by political upheaval and economic hardship. Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina's ouster led to strained relations with India. The nation experienced a shift towards conservatism and a rise in anti-India sentiment. Economic challenges persisted, with concerns over debt and corruption.

articles.title: Why active investing could outperform passive strategies in 2026
articles.summary: As 2026 approaches, experts suggest active, selective investing may outperform passive strategies amid wide dispersion in earnings and valuations. Largecaps remain strong, midcaps show steady growth, while smallcaps lag. Investors are advised to focus on bottom-up stock selection, thematic plays, and balanced allocation across equities, commodities, and debt.

articles.title: Outlook 2026 | Healthcare — how data, AI, and next‑generation analytics are reshaping patient outcomes
articles.summary: The promise of healthcare in 2026 is clear: when data, AI, and next‑generation analytics work in harmony, they redefine what’s possible for patients and the way those possibilities are chosen, notes ZS' Regional Managing Principal, Mohit Sood.

articles.title: Davos 2026 to open on a musical note with Jon Batiste concert
articles.summary: Forum officials said the mix of classical, contemporary, and digital art on the opening day reflects an attempt to blend tradition with innovation at a time of deep geopolitical and technological shifts.

articles.title: Mitessh Thakkar recommends buy on HCLTech, suggests selling Divi's Labs, Asian Paints, and L&T
articles.summary: On Monday, market tech analyst Mitessh Thakkar recommended these stocks for the short term.

articles.title: 96% analysts tracking HDFC Bank say 'buy' on improving margins, asset quality
articles.summary: 48 analysts have coverage on HDFC Bank, where 46 have a 'Buy' rating and the other two have a 'Hold' recommendation.

articles.title: Chinese EV giant BYD is a buy — and not just for its cars, Bernstein says
articles.summary: After beating Tesla in the number of electric vehicles sold, BYD has another big business that investors have yet to fully appreciate, according to Bernstein.

articles.title: Yes Bank mutual fund shareholding rises to pre-crisis levels but retail near two-year low
articles.summary: While Mutual Fund shareholding in Yes Bank has been on the rise pre and post the SMBC deal, the number of retail shareholders has dropped by over 2 lakh over the last two quarters.

articles.title: German military team cuts Greenland mission short, returns after 44 hours
articles.summary: A 15-member German military reconnaissance team completed its planned Arctic assessment in Greenland and departed after 44 hours, citing difficult weather but “important insights” for NATO security coordination.

articles.title: Over 11.32 lakh birds of 196 species flock to Chilika lake this winter
articles.summary: Though there has been a marginal increase in the number of birds this time in comparison to last year, the enumerators have found two new species in the lagoon.

articles.title: Vande Bharat Sleeper flagged off: Features, route, timings and more
articles.summary: India’s first sleeper Vande Bharat train between Howrah and Kamakhya has been flagged off. Here’s what makes it different, its timings, fares, and how it will help travellers.

articles.title: UP: 4.52 crore take holy dip at Sangam on Mauni Amavasya; probe seer's 'mistreatment', says Akhilesh
articles.summary: A senior mela administration official said devotees began arriving at the Sangam ghats from midnight, braving dense fog, and continued to stream in through the early morning hours.

articles.title: Trump’s Greenland tariff gambit sets stage for tough dialogue at Davos, says WEF President
articles.summary: With around 850 of the world’s top CEOs attending Davos this year, World Economic Forum (WEF) President and CEO Borge Brende said Trump remains keen on attending the forum to directly engage global business leaders.

articles.title: Trump invites PM Modi to join Gaza ‘Board of Peace’ as WEF weighs post-war plan
articles.summary: Trump invites PM Modi to join a new Gaza Board of Peace, an international body tasked with rebuilding Gaza, enforcing demilitarisation, and shaping its transitional Palestinian governance.

articles.title: Delhi Metro completes relocation of sub station dismantled due to Central Vista construction
articles.summary: The Park Street RSS was originally built in 2010 during the Phase-II of the Delhi Metro to supply power to the Airport Line and the Violet Line (Line-6), the DMRC said.

articles.title: Himachal govt to spend ₹3,000 crore to boost healthcare sector: CM Sukhu
articles.summary: Emphasising that strong health administration is the backbone of quality healthcare, Sukhu announced decentralisation of administrative and financial powers.

articles.title: Telangana CM Revanth Reddy enrols in Harvard Leadership Programme
articles.summary: Chief Minister to attend executive course at Kennedy School of Government later this month

articles.title: Davos 2026: Global health faces $200 bn shortfall as US pullback adds pressure; AI seen as lifeline
articles.summary: The World Economic Forum says the global health system faces a funding gap of nearly $200 billion after the US reduced support for multilateral organisations. WEF’s Shyam Bishen said health system projects and resilience efforts are being affected. He added that digital health and AI could help reduce waste and control rising healthcare costs, which now total $10–12 trillion a year worldwide.

articles.title: Pakistan receives US invitation to join Board of Peace on Gaza
articles.summary: Pakistan’s foreign ministry said they will continue to engage with international efforts to support peace and security in Gaza. The Board of Peace is a new US-led initiative announced by Trump as part of a broader plan to end the Gaza conflict.

articles.title: UAE President Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed to visit India on January 19 to boost strategic ties
articles.summary: As per Ministry of External Affairs, the visit will allow both leaders to “chart new frontiers” for the Comprehensive Strategic Partnership. This will be Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed’s third official visit since assuming office as UAE president and his fifth in the past decade.

articles.title: Davos 2026: Geoeconomic tensions top business risk for 2026, says WEF's Saadia Zahidi
articles.summary: The World Economic Forum’s Global Risks Report says geoeconomic confrontation is the top risk for 2026 and the next two years. Business leaders are worried about tariffs, investment controls, access to critical resources, and supply chains. Geopolitical and state-based conflicts are the next major concerns, according to WEF Managing Director Saadia Zahidi.

articles.title: Nordic and European nations express solidarity with Denmark and Greenland
articles.summary: Joint statement warns threats could harm transatlantic ties, reaffirms Arctic security commitment

articles.title: Davos 2026: Theme, who is attending, India's presence and more — All you need to know
articles.summary: The World Economic Forum is claiming record levels of government participation, with 400 top political leaders expected to take part, alongside nearly 850 of the world's top CEOs. The top political leaders include 65 heads of state and government and six of the G7's leaders.

articles.title: DPIIT likely to ease FDI norms for existing defence license holders
articles.summary: According to CNBC-TV18 sources, the government is considering increasing the FDI limit for defence companies with existing licences from 49% to 74% under the automatic route.

articles.title: India urges start-ups to focus more on manufacturing, continue work on deep-tech
articles.summary: PM Narendra Modi urged Indian startups to pivot towards manufacturing, deep-tech and space, citing expanded procurement, funding support and policies to position India as a global technology leader.

articles.title: Budget 2026: Industries look for predictability, investment push, and targeted support
articles.summary: Industry leaders want Budget 2026 to focus on growth, reforms, fiscal stability, inclusion, and boost manufacturing, fintech, healthcare, and smaller cities.

articles.title: Piyush Goyal: India-EU FTA will be the ‘mother of all deals’; No EU member opposes
articles.summary: India and European Union may finalise a Free Trade Agreement by 27th January, with support from all 27 EU states. Talks cover CBAM, GI, critical minerals, and aim for balanced trade growth.

articles.title: ‘Nothing is grandfathered’: Supreme Court’s Tiger Global ruling puts pre-2017 Mauritius investments at risk
articles.summary: Tax experts warn verdict may embolden authorities to reopen PE, VC and FPI deals, raising fresh uncertainty for foreign investors

articles.title: Sebi proposes to allow 'netting of funds' for FPIs in cash market to trim funding cost
articles.summary: Under the current framework, an FPI needs to settle equity cash market trades on a gross basis, funding each purchase transaction independently of any sale transactions, even on the same day.

articles.title: SEBI Chairman dismisses FPI exit fears, says outflows cyclical; registration, netting reforms coming soon
articles.summary: SEBI Chairman Tuhin Kanta Pandey said recent foreign portfolio investor outflows are cyclical and modest relative to the scale of overseas investments in India, while outlining upcoming reforms to speed up FPI registration, ease KYC frictions and introduce netting to improve market efficiency.

articles.title: Economists warn debt and geopolitics cloud fragile global recovery: WEF report
articles.summary: Global growth expectations have stabilised, but chief economists surveyed by the World Economic Forum warn that rising debt, narrowing fiscal space and shifting trade flows are creating new fault lines across economies.

articles.title: Economists flag AI stock froth, warn of crypto slide and weaker dollar: WEF report
articles.summary: Chief economists are divided on AI-driven equity valuations, warn of downside risks for cryptocurrencies, see mixed prospects for gold, and expect the US dollar to weaken, a WEF survey shows.

articles.title: SEBI chair drops hints on key market reforms coming soon
articles.summary: SEBI Chairman Tuhin Kanta Pandey signalled a series of changes aimed at making Indian markets more efficient and accessible. From easing processes for foreign investors to tweaks in trading systems, several reforms could be closer than expected.

articles.title: Unemployment rate rises marginally to 4.8% in December 2025
articles.summary: The overall Unemployment rate is estimated at 4.8% in December 2025 against 4.75% observed in November, according to the Periodic Labour Force Survey (PLFS).

articles.title: IMF's Georgieva backs Fed chair Powell, underscores importance of central bank independence
articles.summary: The ‍probe has sparked widespread criticism from some key members of Trump's Republican Party in the US Senate, which must ‌confirm his ‌nominee to succeed Powell, along with foreign economic officials, investors and former US government officials from both political parties.

articles.title: US announces trade deal with Taiwan, cuts tariff to 15% in exchange of $250 billion investment
articles.summary: In response, the US has capped tariffs on Taiwanese auto parts, timber, lumber and wood derivative products at 15%. Generic Pharma and ingredients manufactured in Taiwan will attract zero tariff, according to the Commerce Ministry statement.

articles.title: India’s National Statistical Commission at a crossroads
articles.summary: The Parliamentary Standing Committee flags gaps in India’s National Statistical Commission, urging statutory authority, audits, and harmonisation to restore credibility and ensure reliable data for policymaking and public trust.

articles.title: India’s exports rise in first nine months of FY26, trade deficit widens beyond $25 billion
articles.summary: India’s exports grew 4.3% in April–December 2025 to $634.26 billion, led by smartphones and key markets, even as the trade deficit widened to over $25 billion.

articles.title: DEEP DIVE | Budget 2026: From housing to AI, industry flags execution gaps as the next growth challenge
articles.summary: Ahead of Budget 2026, industry leaders urge policy clarity, faster approvals, and regulatory coherence for sustainable sector growth.

articles.title: India, EU target conclusion of FTA talks within two weeks: Commerce Ministry
articles.summary: India and the European Union are in the final leg of Free Trade Agreement talks, with 20 of 24 chapters closed and negotiations underway daily in virtual mode.

articles.title: India’s merchandise exports rise 1.86% in December, overall exports up 4.33% in first nine months
articles.summary: India’s merchandise exports rose to $38.51 billion in December 2025, with strong growth in electronic goods and marine products, and record overall exports of $215.7 billion in Q3 FY26.

articles.title: RBI proposes to tweak how banks compute FX risk exposure
articles.summary: Reserve Bank of India proposes new FX exposure rules for banks, aligning with global norms, effective April 1, 2027, and seeks feedback on calculation and capital requirements.

articles.title: China’s trade surplus surges to a record $1.2 trillion in 2025 despite Trump's tariff war
articles.summary: The disparity between China's robust manufacturing sector and persistently low domestic consumption is further highlighted by the growing surplus. The second-largest economy in the world has been driven by exports, but its long-term real estate recession and declining investment are limiting the nation's need for imported goods.

articles.title: India’s wholesale inflation rises to 0.83% in December
articles.summary: The Wholesale Price Index, or WPI, measures the change in prices of goods that wholesale businesses sell to and trade in bulk with other companies. Unlike the CPI, which tracks prices of goods and services purchased by consumers, WPI tracks factory gate prices before retail prices.

articles.title: Trade deal hopes can boost mood, but earnings matter more: BofA's Arbind Maheswari
articles.summary: BofA Securities’ Arbind Maheswari said progress in India-US trade talks could improve market sentiment, but long-term returns will depend on earnings growth. He expects about 14% earnings growth this year and a 12% Nifty return driven mainly by profits, with foreign outflows likely to ease and policy support helping the economy over time.

articles.title: Trump vs Supreme Court on tariffs: US President warns of ‘alternatives’ if policy is struck down
articles.summary: Donald Trump warned that an adverse ruling would have wide-ranging consequences, including the potential obligation to return “hundreds of billions” of dollars collected through tariffs. He also alleged that opposition to the tariffs was influenced by pro-China interests, arguing that resistance benefits Beijing. Read on:

articles.title: Jaishankar, Rubio discuss trade, critical minerals and energy amid India-US $500 billion trade push
articles.summary: The conversation comes as New Delhi and Washington attempt to rebuild momentum in bilateral economic engagement after stalled trade negotiations last year unsettled markets and pressured the rupee.

articles.title: Public insurers told to chase profits, younger customers and full digitalisation
articles.summary: DFS, led by M. Nagaraju, reviewed LIC, GIC, NIACL, NICL, UIICL, OICL and AICIL, focusing on profitability, digital onboarding, and customer reforms for FY 2024–25 and 2025–26.

articles.title: UPI user base can more than double to 1 billion: RBI Deputy Governor
articles.summary: Reserve Bank Deputy Governor T Rabi Sankar says UPI can grow to 1 billion users, driving financial inclusion and GDP, with global expansion in countries like Singapore, UAE, Nepal, and France.

articles.title: World faces massive jobs test as 1.2 billion young people near working age: World Bank
articles.summary: The World Bank warns that 1.2 billion young people will enter developing-world labour markets by 2035, making job creation, investment and reforms critical to avoid unemployment and unrest.

articles.title: Global economy holds up despite trade tensions, but developing world still lags: World Bank
articles.summary: One in four developing economies remains poorer than before the pandemic; jobs challenge looms as 1.2 billion youth enter workforce

articles.title: Indian rice exports struggle, but home demand is rising: Kribhco Agri
articles.summary: Rajesh Paharia, Chief Manager–Business Development at Kribhco Agri Business, said Indian rice exporters were already facing delayed payments, currency weakness, banking constraints and rising logistics costs, and that the new tariff has compounded these challenges, increasing risks for those exposed to the Iranian market.

articles.title: Women still locked out of real finance despite 90% bank account coverage: Report
articles.summary: Inclusive Finance India Report 2025 flags inactive accounts, low financial literacy and a 35% MSME credit gap as key barriers to women’s economic agency.

articles.title: How AI can help Ujjwala deliver its next gains
articles.summary: AI can help India shift PMUY from mass access to precision—targeting electric cooking where grids allow, cutting LPG imports, subsidies, and sustaining clean-cooking gains nationwide.

articles.title: Budget 2026: Real estate sector seeks tax realism, faster approvals and infra-led growth
articles.summary: As Budget 2026 approaches, India’s real estate sector is seeking policy clarity on taxes, approvals and affordability as rising costs and shifting demand reshape the housing market. Developers say targeted reforms and infrastructure push could be critical to sustaining momentum across residential, commercial and Tier II city developments.

articles.title: US consumer prices likely stayed elevated in December as data recovers from shutdown
articles.summary: The figures are harder to predict this month, however, because the six-week government shutdown last fall suspended the collection of price data used to compile the inflation rate. Some economists expect the December figures to show a bigger jump in inflation as the data collection process gets back to normal.

articles.title: New labour rules will make hiring costlier, say staffing firms
articles.summary: Executives from TeamLease Services and Info Edge said India’s new labour codes will increase PF and ESI contributions due to a standardised wage definition, raising compliance costs for companies. However, TeamLease said the impact can be absorbed within one annual increment cycle. Info Edge cautioned that higher hiring costs may pressure corporate margins. For gig and quick commerce firms, the shift may largely replace private insurance spending with government social security contributions, li

articles.title: US-Taiwan trade deal on the horizon; focus on chipmaking in United States
articles.summary: As per reports, the import duties would drop from the current 20% to 15%. At that level, Taiwan's shipments would be comparable to those from South Korea and Japan, both of which signed deals last year.

articles.title: Japanese bonds decline as PM Takaichi gears up for political gamble
articles.summary: As rumours that Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi could dissolve parliament and hold elections emerged, the yield on 30-year bonds increased by 12 basis points to 3.52%, while 10-year bond futures dropped by 71 ticks.

articles.title: Real estate developers look beyond metros: Trident Realty bets on tier-2 growth with ₹1,200-cr integrated township in Panipat
articles.summary: As metro affordability tightens, developers pivot to tier-2 cities like Panipat. Trident Realty’s ₹1,200 crore township signals the new growth frontier for Indian real estate.

articles.title: Revised wage rules hit IT, Banks hard as labour codes take effect
articles.summary: HDFC Bank and ICICI Bank saw significant employee cost hikes in December 2025 due to new labour codes, with IT giants like TCS and Infosys also reporting major expense increases.

articles.title: CG Power wins largest-ever, ₹900 crore order for data center project in the US
articles.summary: CG Power and Industrial Solutions Ltd won a ₹900 crore order from Tallgrass Integrated Logistics Solutions LLC, USA, for power transformers for a major data centre project, marking its global entry. Shares of CG Power and Industrial Solutions Ltd ended lower on Friday, January 16, by 2.82% ₹560.65 on the NSE.

articles.title: SBI terminates GMU Kolkata lease; civil society urges RBI to step in
articles.summary: State Bank of India plans to close its Global Markets Unit in Kolkata, prompting Bank Bachao Desh Bachao Manch to urge RBI intervention to protect local banking and employment.

articles.title: GR Infraprojects emerges as L1 bidder for ₹488 crore BESS project at NTPC Mouda plant
articles.summary: G R Infraprojects has emerged as the lowest bidder for a ₹487.78 crore EPC project to implement a battery energy storage system at NTPC’s Mouda Super Thermal Power Station, with the contract slated for completion within 15 months.

articles.title: HDFC Bank Q3FY26 preview: Street eyes steady earnings amid LDR concerns
articles.summary: While headline earnings are expected to remain stable in the December quarter, investor attention will be firmly on HDFC Bank’s balance sheet dynamics, particularly the elevated loan-to-deposit ratio and management’s roadmap to restore funding comfort without compromising growth momentum.

articles.title: HG infra arm gets appointed date for ₹763 crore NH 227B highway project in Uttar Pradesh
articles.summary: HG Infra Engineering’s wholly owned subsidiary has received the appointed date of January 16, 2026 for a ₹763.11 crore NH 227B highway project in Uttar Pradesh, clearing the way for the start of construction under the hybrid annuity mode with a two-year execution period.

articles.title: ICICI Bank Q3 results preview: Street expects steady growth, margins to improve
articles.summary: ICICI Bank is expected to post steady December-quarter earnings, with analysts flagging healthy loan growth, a modest improvement in margins and higher seasonal slippages, while management commentary on growth outlook and leadership continuity remains in focus.

articles.title: Top Stories | Rupee slips, Reliance Industries results, BMC results, India-EU FTA talks and more
articles.summary: Top 10@10 — CNBC-TV18’s daily newsletter featuring the top 10 stories on markets, corporate updates, economic insights, and financial highlights — delivered at 10 pm.

articles.title: India’s startup story won’t be derailed by Tiger Global tax verdict; returns matter more than structures, say VCs
articles.summary: Venture capital investors say the Supreme Court’s Tiger Global-Flipkart ruling reinforces the need for commercial substance over tax optimisation, but insist India’s startup funding and exit momentum will remain driven by strong growth prospects and market returns.

articles.title: From scale to selectivity: Is India’s startup ecosystem maturing?
articles.summary: On the 10th anniversary of Startup India, policymakers and industry leaders point to sectoral diversification, cautious capital and a gradual shift toward deeptech and sustainable growth

articles.title: Reliance Industries steps up new energy push; solar, battery giga factories on track
articles.summary: Reliance Industries ramps up its new energy ambitions, advancing large-scale solar, battery and renewable power projects as it moves from planning to execution.

articles.title: Kohler growing at double the market rate in India, sees no signs of saturation
articles.summary: In an interaction with CNBC-TV18, Chris Ball, President, Kitchen and Bath, spoke about Kohler's openness to mergers and acquisitions in India, its strong balance sheet following the divestment of its energy business, and why being privately owned gives the company a structural edge.

articles.title: Beyond Opulence: Purpose-driven luxury in modern India
articles.summary: Kotak Private Luxury Index 2025 reveals India’s wealthy now value wellness, experiential travel, and purposeful living over mere possessions, with luxury spending up 6.7 percent annually since 2022.

articles.title: RVNL bags ₹88 crore South Eastern Railway order for IP-based video surveillance
articles.summary: Rail Vikas Nigam (RVNL) won a ₹87.56 crore L1 order from South Eastern Railway to supply, install, and commission IP-based video surveillance systems in LHB coaches, to be executed over 10 months, with no related party involvement.

articles.title: Katrina Kaif’s Kay Beauty taps couture for global launch with Falguni Shane Peacock
articles.summary: Kay Beauty and Nykaa launch a couture-inspired makeup collection with Falguni Shane Peacock, blending luxury fashion and beauty, available in India, UK, and UAE with premium packaging and design.

articles.title: Jindal Saw Q3 profit slumps 49% YoY; margins contract sharply
articles.summary: Jindal Saw Ltd reported a 49% drop in net profit to ₹258 crore and a 6.2% fall in revenue for the December quarter. Shares of Jindal Saw Ltd ended lower on Friday, January 16, by 3.64% at ₹154.14 on the NSE.

articles.title: JSW Infrastructure Q3 Results: Net profit up 9% to ₹359 crore on higher cargo, Navkar volumes
articles.summary: JSW Infrastructure Q3 net profit rose 9.1% YoY to ₹359 crore on 14.2% revenue growth to ₹1,349 crore and a 10.1% rise in EBITDA to ₹643 crore, supported by 8% higher cargo volumes and strong Navkar performance; FY2026 targets ₹5,400 crore revenue and ₹2,600 crore EBITDA, with FY2027–28 EBITDA expected to grow sharply.

articles.title: Women lead India’s Big Tech push as Anthropic, Google, Meta and OpenAI expand in India
articles.summary: India’s Tech landscape is reshaped by women leaders, as Irina Ghose at Anthropic and Sandhya Devanathan at Meta drive AI and platforms while Google and YouTube expand across India’s digital economy.

articles.title: Tata Technologies Q3 Results: Net profit rises to ₹616 crore QoQ on strong services performance
articles.summary: Tata Technologies Q3 revenue rose 3.2% QoQ to ₹1,366 crore, services segment revenue increased 4.7% to ₹1,060 crore, EBITDA stood at ₹193 crore with a 14.1% margin, adjusted net income was ₹135 crore, attrition was 15.8%, and workforce totaled 12,580.

articles.title: Tech Mahindra Q3 Results: Profit misses poll, revenue and margins beat estimates
articles.summary: Tech Mahindra posted Q3 net profit of ₹1,122 crore below estimates, while revenue, EBIT, margins and constant currency growth came in higher than the CNBC-TV18 poll, with year-on-year revenue and operating performance improving despite a profit decline.

articles.title: CCPA fines Meta, Amazon, Flipkart and other e-commerce firms for illegal walkie-talkie sales
articles.summary: CCPA took suo motu action against 13 e-commerce platforms including Amazon, Flipkart, and JioMart for selling unauthorised walkie-talkies, imposing ₹44 lakh in penalties.

articles.title: Travel Food Services CEO says third quarter was the busiest despite December hiccups
articles.summary: Travel Food Services CEO Varun Kapur said air travel in India rebounded in the third quarter with low to mid single-digit passenger growth, despite short disruptions in December. The company has started operations at the new Navi Mumbai airport, which is expected to become a meaningful revenue contributor from FY27. Kapur also said the firm is expanding outlets across major airports and that spending per passenger continues to rise.

articles.title: Sterling and Wilson Renewable shares jump 13% on strong order book, topline growth
articles.summary: Sterling and Wilson Renewable Energy reported a net loss of ₹2.8 crore for the quarter, compared with a profit of ₹14.83 crore last year. The bottom line was affected by a one-time loss of ₹30.8 crore arising from contract termination charges.

articles.title: Citi CEO Jane Fraser warns of more job cuts, looks to 'raise the bar'
articles.summary: Citigroup, a New York-based bank whose performance has long lagged below that of other major US lenders, has made streamlining the business and reducing waste a top priority. The bank has undergone a makeover under Fraser, who took over in 2021. This includes reorganising its core business and selling off a large portion of its foreign retail division.

articles.title: Moody's upgrades outlook on Adani Transmission Step-One, Adani Electricity Mumbai to stable
articles.summary: Moody’s said the outlook upgrade reflects its expectation that ATSOL and AEML will continue to sustain liquidity and financial metrics supportive of their ratings. The affirmation of ATSOL’s ratings also reflects its close credit linkages with parent Adani Energy Solutions Ltd (AESL), including guarantees on the bonds and default provisions tied to AESL’s credit profile.

articles.title: NTPC Green Energy board approves 50:50 JV with GAIL for renewable energy projects
articles.summary: NTPC Green Energy Board approved a 50:50 joint venture with GAIL (India) to undertake renewable energy projects, subject to approvals from the Ministry of Power, DIPAM, and other statutory authorities.

articles.title: Tech Mahindra Q3 Preview | Profit and margins expected to improve QoQ
articles.summary: Tech Mahindra is expected to report Q3FY26 net profit of ₹1,385 crore, up 15.9% QoQ, on revenue growth of 1.5% QoQ to ₹14,209 crore and EBIT margin expansion to 12.7%. Constant currency revenue is seen rising 0.6% QoQ, with FY27 guidance for above-industry growth and ~15% margin intact, though growth may be slightly muted versus initial expectations.

articles.title: Angel One Q3 | Declares ₹23 dividend, approves 1:10 stock split; revenue rises
articles.summary: Angel One reported a net profit of ₹268.6 crore for Q3FY26, down 4.5% year-on-year, while revenue rose 5.8% YoY to ₹1,334.8 crore. EBITDA increased 6.7% YoY to ₹529.1 crore, with margins at 39.6%. Broking, wealth management, and credit businesses supported growth, and the board approved a ₹23 interim dividend and stock split from ₹10 to ₹1 per share.

articles.title: Godrej Properties posts 19% rise in CY25 booking value
articles.summary: Godrej Properties Ltd posts 19% rise in booking value to ₹34,171 crore in 2025, reporting cash collections of ₹18,979 crore during the year, up 28% from the previous year; remains India’s largest listed residential real estate developer for second consecutive year.

articles.title: Nuvoco Vistas Q3 back in black with ₹49-cr net profit on record cement sales, premiumisation
articles.summary: Nuvoco Vistas posted a profit of ₹49-crore in Q3FY26, reversing a ₹61.4-crore loss a year ago, supported by record cement sales of 5 MT, 12% revenue growth to ₹2,701 crore, a 48.5% rise in EBITDA to ₹383.8 crore, and margin expansion to 14.2%.

articles.title: SC’s Tiger Global ruling brings pre-2017 investments via tax havens under taxman’s lens
articles.summary: The Supreme Court’s Tiger Global ruling weakens reliance on tax residency certificates, raising fresh scrutiny of pre-2017 foreign investments and potentially reshaping how India applies treaty benefits, experts warn.

articles.title: India at an AI inflection point, $15 bn investment to build data centres, cables, clean energy: Google’s Preeti Lobana
articles.summary: Google’s largest-ever investment in India will focus on creating the backbone for an AI-driven economy, spanning compute capacity, high-speed connectivity and renewable power, as the company positions itself for long-term growth alongside India’s digital ambitions.

articles.title: ANALYSIS: SC tightens treaty abuse net in Tiger Global case, raises bar for offshore investment structures
articles.summary: Supreme Court rules Tiger Global’s Mauritius share sale was tax avoidance, denying DTAA exemption and stressing economic substance over legal form for foreign investments in India.

articles.title: 360 ONE WAM Q3 | Wealth management firm sees 20% profit rise on growth in ARR AUM
articles.summary: 360 ONE WAM posted a 20.3% year-on-year rise in Q3 profit to ₹331 crore, supported by strong growth in ARR AUM; 33.2% increase in revenue from operations to ₹806 crore, alongside higher ARR revenue and improved retention across wealth and asset management businesses.

articles.title: Liquor dues pile up beyond ₹3,900 crore as Telangana prepares for Davos
articles.summary: Telangana faces a liquor sector crisis as over ₹3,900 crore in dues remain unpaid, prompting warnings from BAI, ISWAI, and CIABC ahead of WEF Davos 2026, risking jobs and investor confidence.

articles.title: Supreme Court deals blow to Tiger Global: Flipkart exit gains taxable in India, ₹14,500 crore at stake
articles.summary: The apex court’s ruling overturns relief earlier granted to the global investor and strengthens the tax department’s hand against treaty shopping, potentially impacting a wide swathe of foreign funds that routed Indian investments through Mauritius and are now planning exits.

articles.title: NFRA tightens the screws on auditor–board communication: What it means for CAs and regulators
articles.summary: NFRA’s circular demands stronger, documented auditor-board communication, redefining accountability in India’s audit ecosystem and raising compliance risks for chartered accountants and boards.

articles.title: Taiwan computer chip maker TSMC's to expand investment as profit jumps 35%
articles.summary: TSMC said it plans to boost its capital expenditure budget to $52 billion-$56 billion for 2026, up from about $40 billion last year. The company’s Taiwan-listed shares have climbed more than 6% since the beginning of the year, reflecting its strong position in the AI-driven market.

articles.title: Odisha govt demands ₹1,255 cr from Vedanta's ESL Steel over alleged production shortfall
articles.summary: The notices relate to an alleged shortfall in meeting minimum production and dispatch targets

articles.title: Trade Setup for January 19: Nifty moves for Monday to be determined by RIL, HDFC Bank and ICICI Bank
articles.summary: A move above 25,900 could pave the way for further upside this week. However, a break below the crucial support of 25,500 could open the door to additional downside, analysts say.

articles.title: Big earnings reports and worries around the interest rate outlook could sway markets next week
articles.summary: The New York Stock Exchange will be closed on Monday, Jan. 19 for Martin Luther King, Jr. Day. Here's all you need to watch out for the rest of the week.

articles.title: Q3 Results This Week: Kotak Bank, Eternal, UltraTech among 100 other companies reporting
articles.summary: As many as 120 companies from the Nifty 50 index and the broader markets will be reporting their results for the third quarter in the upcoming week. Some prominent names include Kotak Mahindra Bank, Eternal, Dr. Reddy's Laboratories, UltraTech Cement, and InterGlobe Aviation, among many others.

articles.title: Stocks to Watch for Jan 19: RIL, HDFC Bank, ICICI Bank, Wipro, L&T Finance, CG Power and more
articles.summary: The major Nifty 50 components, Reliance Industries, HDFC Bank and ICICI Bank are the most important stocks to watch for Monday's trading session on January 19. Apart from these, a whole host of mid-sized banking names, IT stocks such as Wipro and Tech Mahindra, along with Netweb Tech and CG Power will also be in focus.

articles.title: FII short positions show India lagging AI boom, says Mihir Vora
articles.summary: FIIs remain heavily net short on India as the country trails Asian peers in AI-led growth, says Mihir Vora, Chief Investment Officer at Trust Mutual Fund Currency weakness and lack of sectoral triggers weigh on sentiment.

articles.title: Rossari Biotech net profit, revenue increase; Margin contracts to 11.8%
articles.summary: Rossari Biotech's net profit was up 3.2% at ₹32.7 crore from ₹31.7 crore int he previous year.

articles.title: Punjab & Sind Bank Q3 Results | Profit rises 19% YoY, asset quality improves
articles.summary: Punjab & Sind Bank reported a 19.3% rise in Q3 FY26 profit to ₹336.4 crore, while net and gross NPAs improved sequentially. Total business grew 11.8% YoY to ₹2.49 lakh crore.

articles.title: SEBI to introduce new framework in equity cash segment to determine closing stock prices
articles.summary: SEBI to launch closing auction session CAS in equity cash segment from August 3, 2026, making closing price discovery more transparent and robust, initially for stocks with derivatives.

articles.title: Maruti Suzuki to invest ₹35,000 crore in Gujarat for new 10 lakh-unit plant
articles.summary: Maruti Suzuki will invest ₹35,000 crore in a new Gujarat plant at Khoraj, aiming for 10 lakh cars per year and creating around 12,000 jobs, the company and state government said.

articles.title: ICICI Bank MD & CEO Sandeep Bakhshi gets two-year extension from board till October 2028
articles.summary: ICICI Bank MD and CEO Sandeep Bakhshi was appointed as the MD and CEO of ICICI Bank in October 2018 and his term was previously extended till October 2026. He is a veteran of the ICICI Group since 1996.

articles.title: RBL Bank warns of credit card slippages to continue for next two quarters
articles.summary: RBL Bank warned of continued credit card slippages in the near term, but flagged improving traction in gold loans and expects marginal NIM expansion in Q4 with stable asset quality.

articles.title: Yes Bank Q3 results: Profit jumps 55% as asset quality holds steady, NII rises

articles.title: Wall Street ends little changed before long weekend

Still, shares of banks and other financial institutions have been pressured by worries over US President Donald Trump's proposed one-year cap on credit card interest rates at 10%. articles.summary: Indian Railways has introduced stricter cancellation charges for its new Vande Bharat Sleeper trains. This initiative aims to boost India's data sovereignty and national security capabilities, reducing reliance on foreign imagery.

This marks the third encounter in the Jammu region this year.

articles.title: New CPI basket won't include free food items
articles.summary: Free food grains from the public distribution system, benefiting nearly 80 crore people, will not be part of the new consumer price index basket. A technical panel decided against including these items to align with global practices, citing potential distortionary effects on inflation figures. This decision follows extensive discussions within the statistics ministry.

articles.title: ICICI chief gets 2-year extension, succession speculation deferred

Bakhshi's tenure has been marked by a significant rise in the bank's stock price and market capitalization.

articles.title: HDFC sets wide deposit targets, flags uncertainty
articles.summary: HDFC Bank's chief admitted to falling short of deposit growth ambitions, setting wide credit-deposit targets due to an uncertain environment. The bank aims to lower its credit-to-deposit ratio from 98.7% to 92-96% this fiscal year and further to 85-90% by FY27, focusing on sustainable profitability amidst a rate-easing cycle.

articles.title: Lowering debt load: Borrowings of NHAI to fall below 2L cr by March

The authority aims for further debt reduction in coming years.

articles.title: AI at work: Adoption outpaces employee training; majority feel unprepared for role changes
